newsitem.title: USA: Muni board urges more care in consultant filings.
newsitem.headline: Muni board urges more care in consultant filings.

text.p: Municipal bond dealers need to be more careful when they file quarterly reports to the Municipal Securities Rulemaking Board about their arrangements with consultants, MSRB's chairman said.
Roger Hayes said in a telephone press briefing that the board will issue a new round of Q&As to deal with the issue in the next two weeks.
Enacted in March 1996, rule G-38 requires dealers to disclose information about their consultant arrangements to issuers and the public via quarterly filings with the board.
"The board felt that some of the reports we are getting need to be done a little differently," said Hayes, managing director of municipal finance for NationsBank Corporation.
Christopher Taylor, MSRB's executive director, said, more "clarity" is needed in the filings. "We've seen variations in the way people disclose stuff," he said.
Some firms, for instance, are not making clear the states where consultants are operating on their behalf, Taylor said.
He said there are a total of six questions and answers in the upcoming filing.
